author: Lucy Clarke-Billings
title: Manhunt for "dangerous individual" with 'pride' and 'honour' tattoos in connection with death of have-a-go hero grandad
text:
Police want to track down Andrew McVicar on the run (Photo: @EssexPoliceUK/Twitter) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Detectives trying to piece together the death of a brave grandad who stepped in to protect his friends during a botched gunpoint robbery are wanting to trace a man wanted in connection with the killing. 
Timothy Smith, 57, suffered a serious brain injury when he was confronted by two men wearing balaclavas who demanded cash as he walked to a friend's home. 
Now cops are trying to track down Andrew McVicar, 33, from Basildon, is wanted on suspicion of murder, robbery and possession of a firearm in connection with the incident in The Drive, Hullbridge a week ago. 
McVicar is described as white, 5ft 9ins tall, bald, of stocky build. He has a Scottish accent and tattoos on his forearms which read ‘HONOUR’ and ‘PRIDE’. 
DI Daniel Stoten, senior investigating officer from the #Kent and #Essex Serious Crime Directorate said: “I need to speak to McVicar in connection with this incident and urge him to come forward before we catch up with him. 
“He’s a dangerous individual and should not be approached. Anyone who has information on his whereabouts is asked to contact my team at Harlow Major Crime on 101 or anonymously via Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.” 
McVicar is believed to have links to the Luton area in Bedfordshire and is thought to have been there as recently as yesterday, March 25. Brave grandad Timothy Smith was 'knocked unconscious during a scuffle with two men' (Photo: Facebook) 
A scuffle is reported to have broken out, during which Mr Smith was pushed to the ground, where he hit his head on a low wall. 
Although he was immediately knocked unconscious, the robbers callously forced the rest of the group - including his wife Lesley and another couple - into the house where they stole cash. 
Tim, who ran a joinery business, was rushed to hospital following the robbery in Hullbridge, Essex, but died on Tuesday. 
His family have decided to donate his organs to help save the lives of others. 
Detectives have launched a murder investigation and are appealing for help in finding the two intruders. 
His daughter Natalie Smith, 27, took to Facebook to thank the public for support. 
She wrote: "Thank you for you kind words.. my whole family just needs as much information as possible even if they think it's not much it all adds up x" Timothy Smith's family have decided to donate his organs to help save the lives of others (Photo: Facebook) 
His niece Kelly Nicholls also shared the appeal and wrote: "Please please share and find these scum who did this to my uncle my family are absolutely devastated." 
Mr Smith had been out for the evening with his wife and friends to the The Anchor pub in Hullbridge, Essex. 
They left at around 11pm before returning to the friends' property, where they were confronted by the men who forced them inside. 
Police carried out a search of the area, assisted by the force helicopter, and enquiries are ongoing to identify and locate the suspects. 
No-one else was hurt during the incident and the firearm was not discharged. 
Detective Chief Inspector Martin Pasmore, of the Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate, said: "This is an extremely tragic incident during which an innocent man lost his life. 
"From our inquiries so far, we understand that during the incident one of the suspects pushed the victim and he fell heavily onto a low level wall, causing a serious brain injury. 
"My thoughts are very much with his family and friends at this very difficult time. 
"We have now launched a murder investigation and are treating this as an isolated, targeted incident." 
Detectives are appealing for witnesses or anyone with information to contact 101 or Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111. On Saturday, March 25, officers made a further arrest in connection with the death of Mr Smith. A 28-year-old man from Basildon is currently in custody having been arrested on suspicion of murder, robbery and possession of a firearm. Like us on Facebook
